column4: I hate to bother you guys but, i am running feisty(7.10) I let it update a few days ago and since then i seem to have lost some desktop functionality, i can no longer see my icons and the context click (on the desktop) no longer functions. Any ideas?
hi..its likely that we can help you fix this problem..however problems with upgrades are far too frequent to assume that this will be the last one..a fresh install make a lot of sense
icons invisible in gnome panel?
then where are icons invisible
you changes anything in gxonf-editor..that sounds like the "display_volumes" flag is set to false
one sec
gconf-editor..in apps>nautilus>desktop..is "volumes visible" checked?
so you have mounted volumes that dont show up...strange..try sudo killall nautilus&&nautilus..see if it gives a useful error mesg
ps -A|grep nau
nautilus is responsible for drawing the desktop
open up any folder..nautilus is the file manager
works?
run from terminal...run the grep command first
using the default icon theme is assume?
some icon themes are buggy/incomplete
terminal output?
glad to help..what happened exactly though?
That worked! Thank you! will they stay there?
if you _really_ need it..i have some stuff to do otherwise
hay..misread the question :)
yes..they should..else add nautilus& to the startup programs in sys>prefs>sessions
it also means that your home folder will get opened in the file manager when you login
you need to kill all instances of nautilus..then start it again
it starts with an option when you start from the panel.. "--filemanger-mode" or something like that
